item.title: Meg add a quote by Ilona Andrews
Meg add a quote by Stacia Kane
item.description: "You know I do, aye? Love you right, Chessiebomb." -- Stacia Kane

item.title: Meg add a quote by Gail Carriger
item.description:
"I suspect it may be like the difference between a drinker and an alcoholic; the one merely reads books, the other needs books to make it through the day."
(Interview with <i>The Booklovers</i> blog, September 2010)" -- Gail Carriger

item.title: Meg add a quote by Kresley Cole
item.description: "You had two prerequisites.” Regin plopped down on a snowbank. “And I do believe I have Russian ex-mil contacts, and I speak the language-“ “Oh, come on! I’ve since learned that you do not by any stretch. You think Dostoyevsky is Russian for ‘How ‘s it hanging?’” She blinked up at Kaderin as she paced by. “Then how do you say it?” “I-don’t-know.” “Then how do you know it’s not Dostoyevsky? No. Really.” She blew a bubble with her gum – possibly the first to do so at this location – but it flash-froze, and she had to crunch it back to gum consistency with her molars. “Obi-Wan, I was your only hope.” (Kaderin and Regin)" -- Kresley Cole

item.title: Meg add a quote by Kresley Cole
item.description: "I do so wish my breasts would stop staring at your eyes." -- Kresley Cole

item.title: Meg add a quote by Kresley Cole
item.description: "I'd wear his corsage to an orgy, any day!" -- Kresley Cole

item.title: Meg add a quote by Kresley Cole
item.description:
"I had just heard tales that the Valkyrie were large warriors, akin to Amazons.”
“If you’re the sole survivor of an army attacked by us, are you going to say we had our asses handed to us by petite, nubile females, or by she-monsters who can bench Buicks?" -- Kresley Cole
